case: Your personal data is not sold
quoteDoc: Privacy Policy, Community Rules, and Terms of Service
quoteText:
No sale of personal information

LibraryThing will not sell or give personally-identifiable information to any third party. This would be evil, and we are not evil. Yes, still.

case: The service will only respond to government requests that are reasonable
quoteDoc: Privacy Policy, Community Rules, and Terms of Service
quoteText: LibraryThing will not cooperate with non-US law enforcement unless compelled, or if we are convinced the law is at least as just, and applied as justly, as US standards.

case: The service promises to inform and/or notify you regarding government inquiries that may involve your personal data
quoteDoc: Privacy Policy, Community Rules, and Terms of Service
quoteText: As of June 30, 2020, we have never received a National Security Letter, FISA order, or any other classified request for user information.

case: Your account can be suspended for several reasons
quoteDoc: Privacy Policy, Community Rules, and Terms of Service
quoteText: LibraryThing staff are empowered to admonish, warn, suspend, and ban users for violations of these terms. We are happy to talk things through, but our decisions are final.

case: You maintain ownership of your content
quoteDoc: Privacy Policy, Community Rules, and Terms of Service
quoteText: We do NOT assert copyright over the things you post to LibraryThing. The phrase "non-exclusive" above means you can post your content elsewhere. By posting something to LibraryThing you let us use it, but you do not restrict what you can do with it.

case: The service provider makes no warranty regarding uninterrupted, timely, secure or error-free service
quoteDoc: Privacy Policy, Community Rules, and Terms of Service
quoteText: Despite our efforts, no security measure can be absolute, and there can be no guarantee that Your personal information will not be accessed through malicious means, inadvertent disclosure, or mistake.

case: The posting of pornographic content is prohibited
quoteDoc: Privacy Policy, Community Rules, and Terms of Service
quoteText: Do not upload X-rated or otherwise highly objectionable pictures.

case: Third-party cookies are used for statistics
quoteDoc: Privacy Policy, Community Rules, and Terms of Service
quoteText: from Google to anonymously track web usage and analytics (Google).

case: Blocking first party cookies may limit your ability to use the service
quoteDoc: Privacy Policy, Community Rules, and Terms of Service
quoteText: If you choose to refuse our cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of this Service.

quoteDoc: Privacy Policy, Community Rules, and Terms of Service
quoteText:
Domain Cookies

We use our own domain-specific cookies to store:

  • Session status
  • Login information
  • General site setting preferences, such as language, display preferences, login, and notification status

These cookies are not essential to using LibraryThing overall, but are essential to LibraryThing's "logged in" site functionality. Disabling them may prevent an individual from signing into the service, from seeing the content they want to see, from changing content, etc.
